overview_of_class: The purpose of this course is to enable students to understand and analyze financial statements and be able to discern the performance and financial health of a company based on these statements. Students will be exposed to and will utilize a variety of financial analysis tools available. These will include tools such as ratio analysis, trend analysis, vertical and horizontal analysis, competitor analysis and industry analysis. The course will be very practical in nature and will look at real companies. Additionally, students will learn some of the more common Accounting tricks and fraud that some companies use to manipulate their financial statements. A basic understanding of Accounting Principles is needed. Prerequisite: ACCOUNT 201 or equivalent. First class attendance is mandatory.
